comments.text:
Created attachment 568493
00-github-shortcuts-5-problems-demonstrated.png

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20111003080622

Steps to reproduce:

When I try to use nearly any website with HTML keyboard shortcuts, the feature fails because type ahead find triggers even on keystrokes where HTML keyboard shortcuts are matched.

http://www.mozilla.org/access/type-ahead/

See the attachment(s) for the specific example of http://github.com. The site has implemented a well-designed keyboard navigation feature, but Firefox type ahead find makes the feature unusable.

https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commits

I am able to attach just one file, so with regret I made a very large pixel-dimension PNG out of five distinct images demonstrating this problem. In order of top to bottom, their title captions are:

01-github-shortcuts-defined.png
02-github-shortcut-j-j-should-nav-twice-instead-typeahead-captures.png
03-github-shortcut-j-c-should-nav-to-new-page-instead-typeahead-captures.png
04-github-shortcut-y-should-perform-action-instead-typeahead-captures.png
05-github-shortcut-y-y-should-perform-action-instead-typeahead-captures.png

Thank you for looking into this usability problem. I am looking forward to designing similar features in my own applications, so-called 'single-page apps' with heavy use of keyboard shortcuts and navigation for advanced users who prefer that mode of user interaction.


Actual results:

HTML keyboard shortcuts in Firefox do not work well with type ahead find enabled (Firefox default). The type ahead find feature captures keystrokes which specifically match keyboard shortcuts defined in the page HTML.




Expected results:

When a keystroke matches a defined HTML shortcut, type ahead find should be suppressed for a reasonable time or input event stream such that the user can complete the intended sequence of keyboard shortcuts.
